Teens playing ball outside our window then screaming & running up and down the hallways. Tried to call thew front desk on our cell phone about this but there was no answer. Some days our room was cleaned, sometimes not. The worst was the natural gas odor in the corridors, like gas was escaping from the outdoor pipes and of course was never addressed. The shuttle to Disney World was the only thing worth the $67 they charged for "resort fees" and that was overly crowded with people standing on most trips. Staff always said they would "get right to it" but most of our complaints remained throughout our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be condemned...............”
Reviews.Author: EGcomp
Reviews.Content: We are a traveling competitive team from northern California who attended the Disney College Showcase from Dec 31-Jan3. We were required to book our hotel through Anthony Travel....a sponsor of the tournament. When our travel coordinator arrived on Dec 28th the hotel was overbooked, but guaranteed that our block of rooms for the team were guaranteed....by the time a majority of our team arrived at midnight (including most of our players) the hotel had given away a number of our rooms. They put these people in rooms that were under maintenance with bunk beds.....the showers produced either extremely hot water or freezing cold water -- nothing in between. Spiders and ants were crawling out of the closets! The next day we spoke at length with the manager, Jeff Howard who had no idea of the situation. We requested to be moved to another property, but he insisted along with Anthony Travel that we"our entire team" had not been inconvenienced. He offered to comp breakfast the next morning, but "renegged" after our team had eaten and said he would cover half! We had toilets that leaked, no towels (or at least not enough, no washclothes or hand towels), blankets the thickness of a table cloth, and no one would answer the front desk phone....at one point it rang for three minutes before someone answered. The odd thing is that on New Years Eve the hotel had a full staff and a full parking lot .....they seemed to have been able to accommodate everyone! While standing in line on the 28th they were turning away guests who had booked on Travelocity -- apparently the rooms were guaranteed through Travelocity, but the Ramada said they were not guaranteed through the hotel....how ridiculous, if Travelocity has bookings with the hotel then the Ramada is obviously contracting with them and the rooms should be guaranteed. Finally the reason the hotel manager, Jeff Howard, knew nothing about the situation was because the staff were instructed not to contact him. We have had better service and accommodations at a Motel 6 or Holiday Inn for half the rate. Mr. Howard, our entire team was INCONVENIENCED as we all came three days early and paid for your crappy hotel and rental cars and reserved soccer fields that we could not use because most of our team was exhausted from having to wait in line for over an hour (at midnight) just to get a room....with spiders, ants, no towels, bad plumbing, etc! Ramada, Anthony Travel and the Disney Showcase Management should be ashamed for recommending such a dilapidated property....this hotel should be condemned (parts of it were actually boarded up!) . We would not recommend this dump to our worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Average 2 star hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: ks1601
Reviews.Content: The rooms were poor to average. Clean enough to stay in for a night or two, but I wouldn't want to spend a week long vacation here. This hotel is in major need of renovations. Yes, the sheets and towels were clean, but the floors, walls, shower, etc. were not. For the price, though, it didn't bother me much. If the service had been better, I might have considered staying here again because of the value. However, service was terrible. We waited in line for 45 minutes to check-in because there were only 2 people working the desk (the resort is huge...during a busy time they definitely need more than 2 desk staff). Waiting to check in for 45 minutes was the last thing I wanted to do after a 15 hour drive to Orlando. That night, it was really cold in our room. The next night we called and asked for extra blankets (they dressed the bed with one top sheet...no blanket)...no one showed up. We called 30 min later to ask for an update. They said they would arrive soon. We fell asleep 45 minutes later without our extra blankets. I got a great rate on this room, but if I hadn't, I'd be complaining a lot more! Look for other hotels in the area with a similar price, but better reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great!”
Reviews.Author: sable2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a beautiful lobby and upon arrival seemed to be more than expected for price and was until the second night. Upon arrival from a long 10 hour fishing excursion, our keys wouldn't work in our door and the wash rags, bath mat, and soap had not been replaced. The front desk was called and still no replacements two hours later. Notification of the absent items at check out and not even a sorry. Might go back, but not without soap, wash rags some things are just a necessity.

Reviews.Title: “It was GREAT for what we needed :D”
Reviews.Author: Zee_1986
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this hotel in oct 2009. i found this hotel was great for what we wanted, we just wanted a pleasent place to spend our nights somewhere safe to stay, and this hotel offered this. I wouldn't recommend u to eat at the resturant in the hotel as the food wasn't that amazing and not much choice especially if you are a vegetarian, but there was plenty of place's to eat out in and around the kissimmee area anyway. I would definitely recommend you to hire a car (with a TOM TOM..!!!) if you want to visit the Florida Parks, you can book it from home and then pick up from the airport. we actually didn't hire a car from home, we thought we would just get shuttles everywhere, we tried this on the first day out and got a shuttle to Sea World which was about $24, they were late on picking us up and tell u what time they pick you up so u have less time in the park. When you arrive at this hotel go and speak to the guys at the concierge, they gave us some great advice on all the places we wanted to visit.. I would recommend this hotel, and i would 100% go back.. :D

Reviews.Title: “Last choice of a place to stay while in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: tilt00
Reviews.Content: . This hotel may have been okay when it was new but it is very much in need of cleaning and maintenance. The room was not clean and the beds were terrible. The sheets didn't stay on the bed. There was mold in the shower and the lighting was insufficient. We tried the buffet for breakfast twice because we thought it would be fast. It was very expensive and items were cold and tasteless and eggs not cooked all of the way. The people at the reception desk were rude and non-responsive. We were there for eight nights and in all of that time, didn’t find anyone helpful or friendly. I can’t find anything nice to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Halloween Horror Night”
Reviews.Author: Lastspider
Reviews.Content: 1. Rooms Stink 2. Lobby Very hot 3. Internet wireless no signal 4. TV with NO Movies 5. Food and Service Horrible

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges and poor management and the staff could care less.”
Reviews.Author: JMGatsby
Reviews.Content: This is what I sent to the Ramada today in response to their Online Satisfaction Survey: The staff were completely incompetent. Had proof of delivery on a package sent to hotel that they insisted was not there. Day one, I called the front desk and asked about it. I was told they would go look and someone would call back. No call back at all. Day two, I went to the front desk and waited 45 minutes for someone to "check". They claim no package. Oh what about my proof of delivery? Oh well, sorry they can't do anything. After I checked out the gave me my package which the security person said was sitting in the back the entire time. I needed the package during my stay so finding it at the end was entirely useless to me. Next, this hotel employs deceitful methods for charging additional expenses to your bill. At check out I was billed a $10 a day "resort fee". Nowhere on my printed reservation receipt was this charge disclosed. The front desk refused to refund it. They responded that on the website there is a checkbox where you agree to the charge. Sure, I remember a checkbox on a website for a reservation I made five months ago. Show me a printed disclosure, not some vague claim. Restaurant service was poor at best, servers seemed annoyed that they had to take care of you. Food ranged from bad to absolutely disgusting. My hamburger (that I waited nearly an hour for) arrived burned to a crisp and completely inedible. The server didn't see why this was a problem. No wi-fi although it's advertised as available. Yes, if you stand in one spot in the lobby you might get a signal. Pretty awful considering I was at a conference in the hotel that required me to be online. Forget the "business center", it was overrun by hordes of 10 year old children surfing the internet and generally acting rowdy. Can't possibly get work done in there. And, no, management did not come by to ask them to calm down. The gym, if you could call it that, had three mismatched weights and no air conditioning. I guess that's part of the "resort fee"?? Never coming back, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, still needs some refinement”
Reviews.Author: ORDVacationer
Reviews.Content: Stayed close to a week at the hotel for a conference. Price was SUPER cheap. Loved the "pool in each pod" set up, alas no hot tubs. Maid service quite slow although the hotel was nowhere near capacity. Numerous problems with key cards - pain to have to go to lobby to get new keys issued. Convention rooms were decent. Service was above par for large banquet. On-site restaurant not always open for all meals. Small snack shop takes FOREVER to get food. Free coffee service in the morning in lobby. For the price I paid, I really cannot complain too much, though! Overall it's a decent place to come back to if you're out sight-seeing all day.

Reviews.Title: “This is a MOTEL not a 3 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Yorks
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the check in we were told they do NOT do B&B. I said we had paid for that and showed our paperwork.Grudgingly they agreed. The electric plate warmers were only turned on once during our stay therefore the food which was only cool was cold before we finished eating. Nice glass tops on the tables. I ran my napkin round and so much dirt was in there. The bar closed at 9pm most nights, some nights it didn't even open. The entertainment had to be paid for if you wanted it,plus compulsary purchase of 2 drinks. I have never known anything like this before. I think it was 2 nights of our stay there was a menu for a dinner, otherwise it is junk food from the pizza place situated in the far end of the lobby. Someone said the pools weren't clean. The one we used was, but most of them were cloudy and the areas surrounding uncared for. Our room was spotless, clean sheets and towels etc every day. How many hotels do you know where there are over 900 rooms with carparking space outside each room? This is a MOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “This place was fine”
Reviews.Author: RACINDIVA
Reviews.Content: The room was large and clean, the bed was comfy and the check in and check out was fast and easy. I was only there for one night, but it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: lblTampa_Florida
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Southern Open Chess tournament and I woud never stay here again. While the rooms were clean and the beds nice, that's where it all ends. The pools were not clean, very cloudy, I was worried about the chemical levels being very low. While there, my children had the great pleasure of being yelled and cursed at by a group of drunken swingers at 4:30 in the afternoon. They had taken over the pool area and claimed they had permission from the management. Apparently, management had scheduled a swingers event for the same weekend as a chess tournament! Really??!! Management denied giving them permission to have the pool closed. The women were topless and kissing each other in a very sexual manner. I was on the back patio of our room with a direct pool view but could not see what was going on until my children ran back to the room in tears. Management, in the end, did take care of us, but I was truly apalled. Two mornings, I was awakened at 6am by the neighboring empty rooms alarm going off about 6am. I had to call and security would come and turn off the alarms. Housekeeping really needs to make sure that the alarms are off in rooms. Walls were very thin as were the bath towels. No free breakfast as promised. Oh, don't count on the free bottled water either. Internet was down for over a day. $10 a day resort fee is outrageous IMO. This was, as my 9 year old daughter put it, a homel. Cross between a motel and hotel. Do yourself a favor and bid for a priceline room, 3 stars should get you something much nice for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: SingingPenguins
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled to Orlando to go to Disney World in celebration of our graduation from high school. It was out first time traveling alone, and we were a group of two eighteen year olds and three seventeen year olds. We all shared one room to keep the cost low, and five nights with continental breakfast and a rollaway bed for the room came out to $441 and change. This was really a great price for the hotel. My friends and I spent our entire first day in the hotel, since we got in at 3:00 in the afternoon and didn't want to spend money on a park ticket for the day. The resort was completely empty, since we arrived June 10, which was the middle of the week and I suppose most schools hadn't gotten out for summer yet. Plus most people who stay there probably spend the entire day at the Disney parks. We ate lunch in the hotel deli, which wasn't bad, and then had the pool near our room to ourselves. We then went to dinner in the hotel restaurant, which was okay, played pool and toyed with the jukebox and then we went up to sleep. It was a nice enough experience. The hotel seemed a bit understaffed (there was one guy running the souvenir shop and the deli) but I assume that had to do with the fact that it was the off season. Overall we had a positive experience. The rooms weren't extravagant but it was enough for us since we really only slept there. We did have a problem with the water on the second night. There were five girls sharing a shower and by the time my last friend went in the water shut off halfway through and didn't come back on until 4am. It was only that one night though, and we had no other problems with the water. Every time we asked for things like extra towels or pillows the staff brought them up in under fifteen minutes. We used the shuttles a few times. It was fairly reliable but for the most part we chose to shell out the extra $5 a day each for a cab since it allowed us more freedom. We were able to call a car easily from the front desk every morning. It was definitely a nice enough hotel for the price we payed and I'd recommend it to anyone else vacationing on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden charges, cleanliness issues..but good value”
Reviews.Author: teacherJax_Fl
Reviews.Content: Nice-sized room, bed was hard, lobby ac not working, spiderwebs growing on sick plants, old and stained furniture, mold on pool tiles....hotel poorly managed, but for a little bit of careful attention, it could be really nice. After all it ended up being 2 nights plus continental breakfast for just under $100. What can you expect?

Reviews.Title: “Good motel for the money”
Reviews.Author: rtmyers5
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried when we first reserved 2 rooms for my wife 3 kids and mother, but after a 6 day stay. I can say that when we go back next summer we will stay here again. the rooms were not fancy, but we nfound them comfortable and clean. the grounds were well kept and we felt safe there as well.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lin64
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from 2 weeks holiday staying in this hotel. i read the reviews before i went and was open minded as it was just some where to sleep as we were going to be at the parks all day, first may i say as a british guest what do you americans expect for your money? ive stayed in 4star london hotels and the rooms were of that standard ,you got a free safe which if you holiday in europe you have to pay for this,the room was cleaned everyday and the hotel and grounds were very clean theres a washing machine and dryer in the hotel which is great,the free continetal breakfast was cereal/bagel/danishpastrys/muffins/yoguat/fresh fruit and juices . the reception staff were always chatty and friendly and you got to use the internet for free.the hotel also offers a free shuttle to the parks 3 in am 3 in pm but if you want you can get the lynx 56 which stops outside the disney transportantion centre right by the free shuttle stop so if you want to get this they are every 30 mins cost 2 dollars and the hotel is the first stop takes just 12 mins you only have to cross the road we used this to get back from parks as the last one 10.50 which means you get to watch the firworks with out rushing for the free bus. i would recommend this hotel to any british guest and take little notice of american reviews as i said they want the ritz for travel lodge money .

Reviews.Title: “Stay here is you want to Sleep with Ants and Blood stained sheets!”
Reviews.Author: Sasha7728
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights at $55 thinking it was a great deal and the pictures of the lobby look great. When we checked into the hotel the first impression based on the lobby looked great but that is where it ended. The rooms look like they haven't been updated or cleaned in 20 years and the rooms had a very musty smell. We booked 4 different room for our party and in our room the safe didn't work and AC didn't either, In another room the latch for the patio door would not open and In the other two rooms we quickly found out that it was covered in Ants, crawling all over the counter and walls. we all got changed to a new room on the second floor in a different area because we were told that they were renovating the hotel and the section they first put us in has not been done yet. The second room was even worst than the first room and it didn't look any different from the first, at this point it was already 12:30 am, we were tired so we just wanted to sleep and get out of there in the morning. When I pulled back the covers, the mattress liner was covered in hair (hair from every part of the body) and there was blood stains on the liner and mattress. We called for new sheets and the security guy came 30 min later with new sheets apologizing saying there is currently no house keeping. We ended up changing our own sheets and slept fully clothed. The next morning we couldn't check out of that hotel fast enough and into a new hotel, I didn't even want to eat the continental free breakfast. The first night of our vacation was depressing due to the hotel. DON'T STAY HERE FOR ANY PRICE!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, low end service”
Reviews.Author: MDFreqTvlr
Reviews.Content: This is a barebones minimum services hotel. It is very convenient to Disney, etc and if you are not planning on spending a lot of time in your room it will work. The check in service is very slow and the restaurant service is non-existent. With so many good restaurant options in downtown Celebration there is no reason to eat at the hotel. Room was clean but very basic. Despite a large conference/convention center there were very few amenities at the hotel, although the pools were a highlight. Again, if you are looking for a reasonable place to sleep while visiting the area this will work, but don't expect a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thecatsmeow98
Reviews.Content: We go into Orlando after a very long trip and expected a nice cool room. The room was hot, the a/c was not on ( found out later it was not even working). we were assigned a room on the 2nd fl ( there were no elevators). We were facing the pool and kids were screaming ( the pool is open until midnite). When we finally get unloaded my hubby goes to get ice to keep his meds cool and there is not a working ice maker in the whole entire pod- he had to go to another bldg still did not find ice). I called the front desk asking for a fan and no they don't have them. I called back asking for another room since the a/c is not working and I have a diabetic that needs to keep his meds at a consistent temp and 73 degrees and climbing is not cutting it they offered to fix it I blew a gasket and walked to the front desk and by this time I was really ticked off. I told the front desk that I had called and asked for another room and why and was turned down and I let them know that if anything happened to my husband because they could not be bothered to give me a room that had a working a/c then the people at the front desk and Ramada Inc would be held liable. I got another room on the bottom floor that time. The next morning they wanted to charge me a resort fee I told them in no uncertian terms no way in hades was that happening and why. I also let them know that this was the 2nd bad experience for us with Ramada and never again would we stay in a Ramada even if we had to stay in our veheicle.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal for a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: williamsalicia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great!! I booked this 3 star hotel on hotwire for $28/night-hotwire then downgraded it to a 21/2 star and credited me some $$ back but I didnt understand why it was downgraded. The hotel reservation area was huge-it was well decorated, their were comedy shows held their, music, their's a gift shop and a breakfast area. Unfortunately the breakfast is not included on hotwire but still was a great value. They have balconies for each room, which is convenient for smokers. They are located on a main highway so everything you need is w/in walking distance. I never felt in danger or anything like that, front desk was always helpful, and the rooms are a basic-nothing lavish, but its a 21/2 star so what do you expect....I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. I wish the fridge and microwave and parking were incluided but for $28, guess they have to make their $$ some way. I stayed for a week and everyday the pools were cleaned and the rooms cleaned. The halls didnt stink and i didnt look around to find if there were any paint chippings or stains on the tiles, if ur that picky pay $300 and stay somewhere else but this hotel is great & if I werent moving to Fl next yr i'd definately use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Sent there for training course. Simple, Clean, and will go again.”
Reviews.Author: Land_Dude
Reviews.Content: Went for a four day mandatory course. Went early enjoyed weekend of warm sun. Had fun in the comedy show on saturday , bucket of beer. My room was simple no frills, but clean. Breakfast was a simple buffet. Training rooms were fine, not too cold. I'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent stay”
Reviews.Author: roaa4
Reviews.Content: I was quite concerned about staying here due to all the negative reviews. I shouldn't have worried. This place was quite adequate. I got a great rate through Hotwire for $33. The hotel is older, however the rooms were updated somewhat and were very clean. The grounds were absolutely beautiful and were kept up. The pool area was also clean, and my only complaint about that, is that it was not heated and there seemed to be a little too much chlorine. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would go back previous reviews do not give enough credit!”
Reviews.Author: Hixxyz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Ramada Celebration in Kissimmee we read reviews on here and was not too sure to expect, was more than pleasantly surprised, if you are a regular kinda person/family with no high expectations and are looking for a cheaper hotel to use as a base to go to sleep and maybe chill out by pool for a bit then this hotel is definitely for you. Rooms were cleaned every day, maids made a real effort in keeping clean, great attention to detail with towels and beds and even folding up your PJ's! free complimentary shower/shampoos daily/ coffee machine in room. On second day we got delivered a fridge without asking, so that was nice. Mattesses looked new really thick and comfy. Rooms are not decorated like 5 star luxury, but remember you are not paying 5 star prices. Free wi-fi which worked all the time in rooms and bar and lobby. Staff very friendly. Who goes on holiday to work out anyway?? Gym looked fine to use. Has own gift shop and market place food deli which is open till late to get your late nights snacks. Bonkerz comedy club in hotel is worth going to, very funny great comedians. You get free shuttle to Epcot in mornings then from Epcot you can catch Disneys free transport to other parks. This changed on our last day and I now think there are 3 times in the morning to go to three park drop off and three times in evening you can catch the shuttle back. Much improved service. If you do not have a hire car ask for a room near lobby we asked and got one no problems. Free continental breakfast is included which is ur usual cereal, bagels, pastries, fresh fruit salad, toast. But you can upgrade to $5 per person for a hot. My only negative comment about this hotel is the hot breakfast, this for me is the only area that needs improving, but not too much of a big deal as you have lots of other restaurants to chose from nearby. Old town is well worth a look and if you want to be gobsmacked a drive through Celebration town is a must, absolutely beautiful and only 5 mins drive from hotel! there is a shuttle service called fun spot shuttle which wil pick you up from your hotel and take you anywhere one the 192 for free!! you dont just have to go to fun spot! Just give them a dollar tip at the end, we used this on the last day as only found out about it last day but what a great service! Lovely hotel complex not scary at all don't know where people get that from?? So all in all very impressed with hotel, not enough credit given too it, would definitely use again as a cheaper base hotel, go for it! you will be pleased! hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “No frills, needs some work, but cheap clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ryanprint
Reviews.Content: We thought we had got a deal booking this hotel, but the photos online are very misleading. At first I was disappointed, but then realized I only paid 29.95/night. You get what you pay for.The hotel is a "Ramada" now , a former Hyatt. The rooms were clean, but very outdated. The hotel has been stripped of its "Hyattness" for lack of better words. The exercise room had no working equipment, and the machines appeared to be broken for some time. Restaurants were closed at the hotel when were were there.The "business center" appeared to have been closed for some time as well. The pools were somewhat dirty and UNHEATED which is not mentioned on the website. This is at best a $45/night chain hotel: clean, conveniently located, relatively safe: but you won't want to "hang out" here. Wouldn't reccomend the hotel to families that want a "be at the pool with the kids" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TAXOL13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and comfortable. The staff at the front desk was very helpful. The pools were spotless. Close to lots of restaurants & stores. Getting to Disney was a breeze. Would definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the horror stories!”
Reviews.Author: cheapprincess
Reviews.Content: #1 great location #2 staff was helpfull #3 comfortable beds #4 clean If you go to disney, what else do you need? You can add $700 moreand stay in a disney value resort. This hotel is very close to shopping and eateries, and a pizza to your room does not cost you 50 bucks. If your seeking a resort go somplace else. If you want to spend 10 hours a day in the parks and need a place to sleep, it is fine. Yes, it could use some updating, but the more money they put into it the more it will cost. My only complaint is the WIFI did not work one day when it was REALLY needed. They were gracious with our complaint and even comped us breakfast. Every hotel in the area charges the $10 per adult resort fee. It is to pay for the free shuttle to and from the parks. The times for the shuttle were undoable for us, so we never used it. I would stay here again. Clean, curteous and a comfortable bed, that 's all we require when we stay somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Hotel between i 4 & 194 Major roads. Free Breakfast useless...”
Reviews.Author: lexgjackson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is between 2 major roads and Very noisy, even with the doors closed. The pool was not heated and cold, no shade around any of the pools. All the balconies are too small to put anything on, so no one used them, (what is the point,,) The breakfast was cerials (no milk to be found) coffee only, and stale bagels. So all had to toast them on the small 4 slice home toaster, worse than quieueing in the parks. worst I have ever seen. so did not bother after the first day. Rooms were clean and recently re-furbished, (our safe was missing..) No security at all, drinks machines on ground floor had been broken into, for cash. Did not feel very safe. loads of noisy kids staying overnight for a large Church meeting at the hotel on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, close to Disney world, seaworld dinner shows ect”
Reviews.Author: Danni091
Reviews.Content: Was pleasently suprised. After reading some of the reviews i was a little scared but it turned out to be a gem. Big rooms which were nice and clean. Easy check-in and out. Close to Disney world 15 mins approx and seaworld about the same. Located off a main highway with a great secetion of food. Mini golf round the corner and close to all the dinner shows. Breakfast was not to bad but had to pay extra to have hot breakfast as the breakfast included was only for cerals ect. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for unauthorized charges”
Reviews.Author: activefam
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel throught hotwire. We got a good deal $33.00 dollars a night. As soon as i found out the hotel name I called and they informed me of the resort charges that they charge. I was fine with that. So at check out I was charged a total of $12.00 for resort charges and taxes. A few days after getting home I checked my checking account and found a charge from the hotel that I did not authorize. I contacted the hotel and I was told I would get a refund in a few days, which never happened. So I called back and was told the same thing. After 2 weeks i went to my bank and the lady at the bank tried to call and get it taken care of, they gave her the run around and said the would call her back and never did. So I had to dispute the transcation at my bank. This hotel took money that they had no right to and then did not want to give it back. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - don't let others scare you away”
Reviews.Author: Jeffreyisu
Reviews.Content: Like many others on here, we booked through Priceline.com by naming your own price. We picked $35 per night and this is the hotel we got. I was very concerned at first by reading all the negative posts, however the hotel is clean and did just fine. My wife and I went to Disney for a Valentines getaway weekend. The rooms were actually pretty spacious for 2 adults, it was clean, somewhat outdated, but many hotels are the same outdated status and asking over $100 per night. There are extra charges, $5 plus tax per night for a parking/resort fee. However, all these people on here claiming "hidden fees" and "Surprise charges" simply didn't read what they signed. In BOLD print right under where I was asked to sign at check in, it stated there would be a $5 per night charge. Overall a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Runaway! Runaway!”
Reviews.Author: krommec
Reviews.Content: When hotwire was giving this place away for $28 a night, that should have been my first clue. The people at the desk were nice, our room was clean but OLD, but a lot of things were just not right. The room didn't have an alarm clock. We called the front desk for a wake up call that never happened -- luckily my husband wakes up pretty early on his own. There were what appeared to be urine stains on the wall in the hallway. The other clientele was, well, more of that you'd expect to see in a cheap roadside motel. I didn't feel safe leaving our luggage in the room and we therefore took it with us when we went out for the day. So, we only stayed for one night and booked another hotel for the other two nights.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel disaster”
Reviews.Author: fooddood
Reviews.Content: Some of the nicest staff working at the worst property ever. the hotel is going through a conversion from hyatt to ramad but these guys are a mess. on top of little training for the client support folks who are nice, but poorly equiped...the following didnt work... phones and wifi in an entire segment of the hotel shower in my room key in my room run away until they sort out their problems

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel by it's looks!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelin_tigger
Reviews.Content: Although this resort is recently updated, it's basically superficial. New coats of paint and clean rooms give it a great look, but once you're in the room, that's where the problems start. In my room, the heater/air conditioner/fan unit didn't work at all. Come to find out, there were numerous complaints I heard at checkout - no hot water, no heat, etc. and that was in the 5 minutes I was there. One furious guy asked to speak to the supervisor and was told the supervisor wasn't in and they wouldn't help him. Also be aware of the hidden resort fee: $10.65 attached per day and not told of up front. Other than that, location was great and that’s the only good thing about it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look out for rip-off charges and skewed star ratings”
Reviews.Author: reid77
Reviews.Content: We had a three-night resort stay booked in Orlando, but decided to tack on an extra day at the very beginning. We booked this property via Hotwire for $33 per room per night ($47 with taxes and junk fees) and we booked two rooms total. Obviously, the price was nice, but we still felt baited and switched. But first, let's mention the positive: the rooms were perfectly adequate, the beds were very comfortable, the gym was good for a property at its level (I'm a workout addict) and the staff was largely pleasant to deal with. Sleep was quiet and undisturbed. However, on the negative side, despite my booking via Hotwire (which is supposed to be 100% prepaid, barring incidentals like phone calls and on-site dining) the property decided to charge me some previously undisclosed fees: $5 (plus tax) per car for parking (which is OK in a downtown area but on a sprawling property next to the interstate? C'mon!) and another $5 per room (again, plus tax) as a "resort fee." Needless to say, I began the stay feeling ripped off, which isn't a good way to make your guests happy, and I've complained to Hotwire about that too. The price should be the price, and any mandatory extras should be fully disclosed online. Finally, Hotwire represented this property as a three-star. Now, in my experience a three-star is a building where the lobby can be reached from a guest room via an elevator ride (i.e. "minimal full-service" like Holiday Inn and Radisson). In this case the rooms were in clusters of 20 or so, in two-story buildings spread throughout the property and exterior stairways. To get to the lobby from nearly any room was a serious hike -- that's a two-star motel to me, not a three-star hotel property. On top of that, the guest areas needed work -- lots of scuffing, missing paint and needed maintenance. Bottom line: had it been two-star rated, and had I not been charged the extra rip-off fees, I would have been perfectly happy with the stay. With all that, no way.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not usual Ramada standards, but OK.”
Reviews.Author: MapleScotland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over new year. On first inspection the property looks OK. The lobby is nice, but the rest of the main area could do with updating. The staff on the front desk were extremely slow and their lack of attention caused us big problems on the first night. To cut a long story short they forgot they had allocated us our room, allocated it to someone else a few hours later and we were woken from sleep by someone entering our room. Scary!!!! The property is motel style with small blocks of 10 or so rooms, so I didn't feel very safe in the first place. The grounds are huge and not very well lit so trying to find your block is a nightmare. The room was ample size, clean, had a comfy bed and had all basic amenities. The decor is abit dated though. Breakfast was very reasonably priced and they had a good selection. There is a small shop and the staff there were friendly and helpful, as were the staff on the concierge desk. There are a few good restaurants and a supermarket within walking distance. The hotel is next to the highway so Disney can be reached in approx 10 -15 mins and Universal 20-25 mins. There are small pools throughout the grounds, but we didn't use them so can't comment. They looked OK though. Overall I would say that this hotel was OK for a budget break. You don't spend alot of time there anyway when you are at the theme parks all day. I would stay there again if I had to, but wouldn't choose to. Definitely not up to Ramada's usual standards.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Ramada "Convention Center" Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: pinkchicago
Reviews.Content: Our flight back home to Chicago on Christmas Eve was cancelled due to bad weather in Chicago, so we had to find a room to stay one additional night in the Orlando area. So we booked the Ramada Celebration Convention Center sight unseen through calling Expedia from our rental car. When we arrived, the appearance of the property and the unsavory people walking around worried us. It was night. My husband checked in and drove us to a remote motel style building. You could tell that some people actually live in this motel because some of the people had Christmas lights hanging in their hotel room windows. As we were about to get out of our car and go into our room we saw a Ramada security/staff person running around the outside of the motel building we were about to enter. He seemed as though he was searching for someone for an unknown reason. My husband told me to stay locked in the car and he checked out the room. Neither one of us is too picky, but he said that it looked so bad and the property didn't feel safe, so we weren't going to stay. We called Expedia, who called the Ramada. The Ramada refused to give us our money back even though all we did was look at the horrible place, but thankfully the Expedia representative told me that she would give us a full refund. Due to Expedia's understanding, we will absolutely book through them again. My husband had to wait almost an hour to give back our room key and tell the Ramada staff that we weren't going to stay there. The Ramada staff was rude and did nothing to try to apologize. Since we still needed somewhere to sleep we ended up walking into a Holiday Inn on the same street (also in Celebration) and we were happy with the room, the safe surroundings and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “value can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: kimmygpt
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotwire and got a great rate. So much so that I wasn't expecting a lot but was pleasantly suprised. Clean room, with comfortable beds and accomadations. Heated pool that was shared between 4 buildings in a pod, so it was private and conveinent. There was no refrigerator but rented one for $5 a night which was well worth it. Very close to Disney and restaurants. Worst experience was that I had to recheck in because the reservations were under 2 names and they couldn't get it right.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Orlando Celebration Resort & Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 6375 West Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway, Kissimmee, FL 34747
